channel.description: Cyber Security Consultant | Online Content Creator | Exponential Coach

item.title: pain and pleasure
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: Achieving deeper levels of fulfilment by choice When looking at punishment and reward in terms of educational methodologies, it’s psychologically proven that rewards are more effective than punishment.1 So far so unsurprising as pleasure promotes a higher state of being than punishment. If everything I believe in turns out to be a shared objective factual experience, that means that there is a natural drive towards a higher state of being, otherwise referred to as the good in every human being, against all odds.

item.title: the all hyped up .uk top level domain
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: .uk is the Internet country code top-level domain (ccTLD) for the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland. As of March 2012, it is the fourth most popular top-level domain worldwide (after .com, .de and .net), with over 10 million registrations. Starting 10th June 2014 it is now possible to register domains ending with a plain .uk. People may have wondered for ages as to why there were only .

item.title: my take on "The Reimagined Battlestar Galactica"
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: Coming from a perspective of being one of many serious Star Trek fans who have watched absolutely every episode and movie there is out there, presently I can't tell which of these I like better.

item.title: LBPC#042 - Bergmuffel
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: LBPC#042 - Bergmuffel Die geilsten Berge der Welt vor der Nase und fast nie oben? Shownotes Wir leben im Alpenvorland da leben und arbeiten wo andere Urlaub machen wie oft sind wir eigentlich auf den Bergen? einschlafen in der Badewanne Die Moar Alm auf der wir vor einem Monat waren ist hier von uns verfilmt worden: Teilnehmer: Mark Cheret und Samuel Antosch

item.title: my first post with a new CMS
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: after more than a decade Just so you know, I’ve been a WordPress user, admin, and plugin author for more than a decade now. I could’ve set this up as yet another one of those ubiquitous WordPress pages. This time, however, I’m taking a different approach. HUGO is my tool of choice as I’m a DevSecOps Advisor, leaning into Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and of course the automation behind this declarative setup.

item.title: the act of creation
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: The act of creation is the manifestation of invisible potential into actual tangible reality.

item.title: fear of judgement in expressing emotions
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: Fear of judgement in expressing emotions is a very common stance which holds us back from having an honest conversation with others and sometimes even ourselves.

item.title: Inspirations 2017
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: I'm continuing my tradition of reflecting who inspired me in the past year and why.

item.title: Shape your elevator pitch (Networking Series Part 5)
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: Your elevator pitch, that is the way you’re introducing yourself, should be something you’re working on constantly. Elevator pitch One of the most important ways to brand yourself and let people know what you do is your elevator pitch. So how do you make sure you can get your message across the right way? How can you start raking in those requests to be hired by the right people you can help best?

item.title: Branding through events (Networking Series Part 4)
item.author: cheret.en
item.description: The types of events you attend shape your personal branding. Events overload I know you’re part of at least one group that has something to do with networking. And you also get asked a lot to attend major or minor events. It sometimes feels overwhelming and you can’t decide which events to attend. I’ll give you this tool to make a quick yet informed decision of which of all the events will really be the productive one for you.
